What are you thankful for this week?: He aha kāu mahalo no kēia pule?
What are you struggling with and how can: He aha kāu e hakakā nei me ka pehea e hiki ai iā mākou ke kōkua?
How did you put into practice the script: Peheaʻoe i kau ai i ka hoʻomaʻamaʻaʻana i ka palapala hemolele / moʻolelo mākou i aʻo ai i ka manawa hope a mākou i hālāwai ai?
Who did you share last week's lesson wit: ʻO wai ka mea āu i kaʻana aku i ka haʻawina o ka hebedoma i hala a pehea e hele ai?
What needs did you meet in the community: He aha nā mea āu i hālāwai ai ma ke kaiāulu i ka pule i hala?
Ask someone to read the passage one para: E noi i kekahi e heluhelu i ka pauku i hoʻokahi paukū i ka manawa.
Have a group member tell it in their own: E haʻi i kahi lālā o ka hui i kā lākou mau'ōlelo pono'ī.
Ask the group if they added anything or: E noi i ka hui inā hoʻohui lākou i kekahi mea a haʻalele paha i kekahi mea.
When you finish with ALL paragraphs, ask: Ke hoʻopauʻoe me nā paukū āpau, e noi aku i kekahi i ka hui e haʻi i ka moʻolelo a pau e hoʻomanaʻo. E hoʻoponopono i ka hui i nā hewa.
What does this passage tell us about God: He aha keʻano o kēia pauku e haʻi mai ai iā mākou e pili ana i ke Akua?
What does this passage tell us about peo: He aha kēia'ōlelo e haʻi ai iā mākou e pili ana i nā kānaka?
If this passage is true, what behaviour: Inā heʻoiaʻiʻo kēia pauku, he aha ka hana e hoʻololi ai i kēia pule?
Who will you tell this story to this wee: ʻO waiʻoe e haʻi i kēia moʻolelo i kēia pule?
What needs can we meet in the community: He aha nā pono e hiki ai iā mākou ke hālāwai me ke kaiāulu i kēia pule?
When do you want to meet again?: I ka manawa hea e makemake ai e hui hou?
Would you like to discover with your fri: Makemakeʻoe eʻike me kāu mau hoaaloha he aha ke Akua e like me ke Akua e makemake ai e ola?
Here are some questions to get your disc: Eia kekahi mau nīnau e hoʻomaka ai i kāu kūkāʻana.
Would you like to discover for yourself: Makemakeʻoe eʻike noʻoe iho he aha ke Akua e like me ke Akua e makemake ai e ola?
Most people like to make these discoveri: ʻO ka hapa nui o nā poʻe e makemake e hana i kēia mauʻike i kahi hui me kā lākou mau hoaaloha.
